text: I've forgotten to bump the Project.toml version when tagging a GitHub release (or vice versa) a few times now. Can TagBot be used for unregistered packages, or is there some other workflow that's recommended to make sure the two version-specifiers stay in sync?

elements.text: I've forgotten to bump the Project.toml version when tagging a GitHub release (or vice versa) a few times now. Can TagBot be used for unregistered packages, or is there some other workflow that's recommended to make sure the two version-specifiers stay in sync?

text: TagBot works to keep releases in sync with the registry, but not directly with the Project.toml. It gets triggered by new releases in the registry (not by new versions in the Project.toml). So I don’t think it would work for that use case.

text: You can use <https://github.com/bcbi/VersionVigilante.jl> to setup reminders to bump the version in PRs if you want. Won't help with the syncing but it helps with forgetting about bumping it
